broadwick.statistics.distributions

Class HypergeometricDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • broadwick.statistics.distributions.HypergeometricDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DiscreteDistribution

    public class HypergeometricDistribution
extends Object
implements DiscreteDistribution

    The hypergeometric distribution applies to sampling without replacement from a finite population whose elements can be classified into two mutually exclusive categories like Pass/Fail. As random selections are made from the population, each subsequent draw decreases the population causing the probability of success to change with each draw.

    See Also:
    Hypergeometric distribution (Wikipedia), Hypergeometric distribution (MathWorld)

      HypergeometricDistribution(int popSize, int sampleSize, int numSuccesses)

    • Constructor Detail

      • HypergeometricDistribution

        public HypergeometricDistribution(int popSize,
                                  int sampleSize,
                                  int numSuccesses)
        A hypergeometric distribution gives the distribution of the number of successes in \(n\) draws from a population of size \(N\) containing \(n_{succ}\) successes. \(N,n,n_{succ}\) can be any integers such that \(N\ge n>0\) and \(N\ge n_{succ} \ge 0\).
        Parameters:
        popSize - the population size, \(N\).
        sampleSize - the number of draws, \(n\).
        numSuccesses - the number of successes, \(n_{succ}\).

    • Method Detail

      • sample

        public int sample()
        Description copied from interface: DiscreteDistribution
        Generate a random value sampled from this distribution.

        the sampled value from the distribution.

      • getMean

        public final double getMean()
        Get the numerical value of the mean of this distribution.

        For population size N, number of successes m, and sample size n, the mean is n * m / N.

        Specified by:
        getMean in interface DiscreteDistribution
        Returns:

      • getVariance

        public final double getVariance()
        Get the numerical value of the variance of this distribution.

        For population size N, number of successes m, and sample size n, the variance is [n * m * (N - n) * (N - m)] / [N^2 * (N - 1)].

        Specified by:
        getVariance in interface DiscreteDistribution
        Returns:
